page.title: 16Haslington's Folklore.
page.content: Haslington means "the farm among the Hazels" of which there was a profusion in the neighbourhood. In 1642 Dragoners stayed in Haslington on their way to relieve the siege of Nantwich. In 1644 the body of a soldier was hung o the gallows on the heath and is said to haunt the area. The highwayman,Dick Turpin is said to have stayed at the Hawk Inn for rest. There is an annual flower show in the village. There is a Service of Remembrance every year for those who died in the two World Wars held around the cenotaph by the Yoxall Institute.
